items.title: LAPAROSCOPY
items.description: It is a surgical procedure in which a fibre optic telescope is inserted through the abdominal wall to view the organs in the abdomen and perform surgery.

sections.title: Procedure
sections.description:
• Done under general anaesthesia in the operation theatre
  • Patientâ€™s abdomen is painted with antiseptic and draped
  • Small incisions are made on the abdominal wall to insert 5mm or 10 mm trocars. Pneumoperitoneum is created by introducing CO2.

sections.title: Diagnostic laparoscopy in infertility
sections.description:
• Used to visualize the uterus, ovaries and tubes and detect any problems in the same.
  • A dye called methylene blue is instilled into the uterus to confirm patency of tubes.

items.title: LUTEAL PHASE OF MENSTRUAL CYCLE
items.description:
• Luteal phase is the second half of the menstrual cycle starting after ovulation and ending either in pregnancy or start of next periods.
  • In most women it lasts 12 to 14 days.
  • Progesterone is the major hormone of the luteal phase which is essential for the maintenance of any on-going pregnancy.
  • Luteal phase defects can lead to recurrent pregnancy loss or infertility.(centre image)
